1.brief: a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application

2.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to balance, i.e. measure out (by weight or dimension); figuratively, arrange, equalize, through the idea of levelling (ment. estimate, test)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)

roomy, in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, plowing, i.e. (concretely) freshly plowed land
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to press; (by implication) to be close, hurry, withdraw
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin

to drag off roughly; by implication, to bring up the cud (i.e. ruminate); by analogy, to saw

a roof; by analogy, the top of an altar
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
